title: Add npx MCP server support to ALAN.Agent
description:
Epic: Enable ALAN.Agent to spawn and manage MCP servers via npx commands (stdio transport). Currently only HTTP transport is implemented.

## Current State
- McpConfigurationService only implements HTTP transport
- YAML config model already supports command/args/env for npx servers
- Documentation shows npx examples but they don't work yet

## Goal
Add full stdio transport support to spawn npx-based MCP servers

## Success Criteria
- [ ] Agent can spawn npx MCP processes
- [ ] Environment variables are properly passed
- [ ] Process lifecycle is managed (start/stop/restart)
- [ ] At least 2 popular npx MCP servers configured and tested

title: Implement stdio transport in McpConfigurationService
description:
Add stdio transport support to McpConfigurationService to spawn MCP servers via npx/command.

## Technical Details
- Use ModelContextProtocol.Client StdioClientTransport
- Spawn process with configured command and args
- Pass environment variables from config
- Connect to stdio streams for MCP communication

## Files to Modify
- src/ALAN.Agent/Services/MCP/McpConfigurationService.cs

## Implementation
1. Add check for command-based servers (not HTTP)
2. Create ProcessStartInfo with command, args, env
3. Use StdioClientTransport from MCP SDK
4. Create McpClient and list tools
5. Store process reference for lifecycle management

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Can spawn npx process with command/args
- [ ] Environment variables are resolved and passed
- [ ] Tools are discovered via stdio
- [ ] Process is tracked for cleanup

title: Add MCP process lifecycle management
description:
Add process lifecycle management for spawned MCP server processes.

## Technical Details
- Track spawned MCP processes
- Implement graceful shutdown on agent stop
- Handle process crashes and restarts
- Clean up zombie processes

## Files to Modify
- src/ALAN.Agent/Services/MCP/McpConfigurationService.cs
- src/ALAN.Agent/Services/MCP/McpProcessManager.cs (new)

## Implementation
1. Create McpProcessManager service
2. Track Process objects by server name
3. Implement IDisposable/IAsyncDisposable for cleanup
4. Add restart logic for crashed processes
5. Register as hosted service for shutdown hook

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Processes are tracked by name
- [ ] Graceful shutdown kills all MCP processes
- [ ] Crashed processes can be restarted
- [ ] No zombie processes after agent shutdown
